dcterms:title: Prophylactic and long-lasting efficacy of senolytic CAR T cells against age-related metabolic dysfunction
dcterms:abstract: Senescent cells, which accumulate in organisms over time, contribute to age-related tissue decline. Genetic ablation of senescent cells can ameliorate various age-related pathologies, including metabolic dysfunction and decreased physical fitness. This study demonstrates that CAR T cells targeting senescence-associated protein uPAR can effectively eliminate senescent cells, improving metabolic function and exercise capacity in aged mice.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Methods
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: All mouse experiments were approved by the MSKCC Animal Care and Use Committee. Mice were maintained under specific pathogen-free conditions. C57BL/6 mice were used for experimentation.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: uPAR-targeting CAR T cells significantly reduce senescent cell burden and improve metabolic functions in aged mice, as evidenced by lowered glucose levels and improved physical performance.

cito:cites.dcterms:title: Impacts of cellular senescence on health span
Senescence and the immune system: From damage to technique
